alert.note: Alert for Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 8:24PM CDT until May 18 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: .Heavy rainfall in a short period of time has produced some flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Calhoun and Talladega. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Several roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 824 PM CDT, Emergency management reported heavy rain and flooding in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anniston, Oxford, Talladega, Cobb Town, West End-Cobb Town, Saks, Lincoln, Munford, Hobson City, Bynum, Grant Town, Anniston Regional Airport, Talladega Municipal Airport, Oxford Lake, Talladega Superspeedway, Blue Mountain, Jenifer, Anniston Army Depot, Eastaboga and Jackson Shoals.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
